definition: worn-out shoes/a worthless thing
my (polite)/poor/ruined/shabby/worn out/defeated
slippers
to toss away like a pair of worn-out shoes (idiom)
to throw away like worn out shoes
to care nothing for worldly fame and glory (idiom)
to regard like a pair of worn-out shoes/to look on sth as worthless

sentences.english: It is dangerous that many people view integrity as having little more value than a worn out boot.
sentences.chinese: 如今很多人棄誠信如同敝屣，這是非常可怕的。

sentences.english: Virtue took on a narrow meaning with the final result that the word virtue fell into desuetude.
sentences.chinese: 美德僅具有狹障的意義，結果必然被棄如敝屣。

position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
to despise/to scorn
humble/lowly
wealth and official post
to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
without meaning/nonsense/immoral/faithless
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
